page.title: 03CHANGES IN LAND USE,PRESTON
page.content: The{Western half}of our block(i.e. squares 3,4,7,8,11 and 12) has seen many changes in the last 15_20 years. Now, the 'village'of Walton_le_Dale is one part of the greater{suburban deve_ {lopment}south of the Ribble. Most of the, even nationally_known, local{employers}such as Atkinson's Vehicles, Pre_Mix Concrete, Horsley _ Smith Timber, Carrington and Dewhurst Textiles,have closed, with the notable exception of Baxi Heaters. This area is one of{part dense hous_ {ing}(although Walton Green,address of {St.Leonard's,}is a conservation area), and{part agriculture / 'open space'. Dairy{farming,}with hardly any arable, is the remaining agricultural usage. Parks,a new link_road which has left many open acres as verges, and foot_ paths across'islands'of fields,all go to provide welcome open_air amenities.
